page.title: 03CHURCH RESTORATION 1985
page.content: Saint Peters church is 800 years old, it was last restored in 1801.Since the new Rector arrived the building has been restored by young people for the Redundant Church Fund. The most valuable part is known as the Corbet Chapel.In here it is very dusty,a bit smelly and wood has rotted.You can see a stained glass window with all sorts of lovely colours.The window shows the crests of the Corbet family who owned the area years ago.At the moment they have replaced the tower roof,cleaned all the pews and repaired carved wood work.Some of the money to repair the church comes from the Church Fete and the annual Harvest Auction.Some walls have been repapered.The Church yard is now kept much tidier too.
